title: Gary Wilson steams through record-breaking Championship League Group Three
text:
Gary Wilson is having a great debut in the Championship League (Picture: Getty Images)

Gary Wilson stormed through Championship League Group Three to book his spot in the Winners’ Group next March.

The World Championship semi-finalist has continued the, somewhat surprisingly, good form he showed at the Crucible into a positive start to this season.

The 34-year-old topped Group Three, losing just one of his six matches, then romped through the semis and final, dropping just one frame in the process.

The only man to beat Wilson in the group stage was his namesake Kyren, with Gary gaining revenge with a 3-0 victory over him in the final on Tuesday.

It is the Tyneside Terror’s debut in the Championship League and, after missing out in the semi-finals of Group Two, he appears to be taking to it very nicely indeed.

‘I struggled in the first group but felt I played a lot better in this group,’ said Wilson. ‘I missed some daft balls but generally I scored well.

‘The tables are playing really nice and scoring is my game. There are things to work on in my game but scoring is my strong point.

‘It has been nice to play a couple of groups but you don’t want to keeping going too long because you want to get into Winners’ Group. It’s nice to get through and I can look forward to March.’

It was a record-breaking couple of days for the tournament, which dates back to 2008, as more centuries were made in Group Three than any other group in the history of the event.

There were 24 centuries made over Group Three, which was one more than last year’s Winners’ Group, which set the record.

The Championship League is a non-ranking event, but is a nice little earner for those involved, with Wilson making £8,950 for his performances over two groups, and with more prize money available in the Winners’ Group.

Wilson has reached the semi-finals of the Six-red World Championship and the quarters at the International Championship so far this season, with runs to fourth and third rounds elsewhere.

He missed out on qualification for the upcoming World Open, but the world number 19 will be back in action at the Northern Ireland Open next month.

Championship League Group Four is played over Wednesday and Thursday, featuring Scott Donaldson, Graeme Dott, Joe Perry, Kyren Wilson, Tom Ford, Ali Carter and Matthew Selt.
